content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Hello, Haoyu Wang. I am not interested in discussing the rental price. The reason is, I want to focus on negotiating the price for the apartment I own in Germany, not in Duisburg. So, let's start discussing the rental price of the newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
I don't want to continue the negotiation, because the given situation involves discussing an apartment different from the one mentioned initially. However, let's concentrate on finding a suitable rental price for the newly built 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center.

To start the negotiation, I would propose a reasonably low amount, keeping market trends and the apartment's location in mind, but still leaving room for adjustments as we go along. Let's say my opening offer would be "I agree to the price of 450 Euro!" From here, we can work together to find a mutually acceptable price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because we have not reached a mutual agreement on the rental price. However, I am willing to negotiate further. Please propose a new rental price that you think is suitable for the newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
Understanding your stance, let me reconsider and propose a slightly adjusted offer. Considering the location and size of the apartment, my revised offer would be "I agree to the price of 475 Euro!" This price reflects a fair balance between your needs as a landlord and my goal to secure the rental at the lowest possible rate. I am open to further negotiations and compromises to reach a mutually satisfying agreement.

Please do share your thoughts on this new offer and let's continue the conversation to find the best suitable rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because we have not reached a mutual agreement on the rental price. However, I am willing to negotiate further. Please propose a new rental price that you think is suitable for the newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
Apologizing for the previous repetition, I acknowledge the need to keep the conversation progressing. Given our discussions and the context of the apartment, I am adjusting my proposal once more. My new offer would be "I agree to the price of 490 Euro!"

This price maintains a balance between your expectations as a landlord and my goal to minimize the rental cost. Let's engage in further dialogue to find a suitable compromise and reach an agreement on the rental price for the apartment. I look forward to hearing your response.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because we have not reached a mutual agreement on the rental price. However, I am willing to negotiate further. Please propose a new rental price that you think is suitable for the newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
I apologize for the recurring situation, but I'm determined to find a common ground in our negotiation. In light of our discussions and considering the apartment specifics, I present a revised offer: "I agree to the price of 505 Euro!"

This price attempt balances your landlord expectations and my aim to secure the rental at a reasonable cost. Let's engage in further communication to reach a mutually satisfying agreement on the rental price for the apartment in the city center. I am open to discussing alternative proposals as well. I await your response.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I agree to the price of [510] Euro!
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
